epp:phrases.epp:phrase: A summary of the items content. If the item has a formal abstract then that is what should be entered here. No complicated text formatting is possible.
Natural language terms to describe the content of the item.

Enter in the format given on the first page or title page. If there are more than four authors, click on the button.
Example: [Smith] [J.P.] [j.smith@soton.ac.uk]
Example: [Chance-Collins] [Chris] [chris@bar.com]
Example: [Fu] [Yan-Li] []
Example: [von HÃ¶pfner] [Ludwig G.] []
Specify the responsible person for publication.

Please enter the names of the editors.
This field is required if no creators are listed.
Companies that are considered authors of this item.
Enter contributors' names along with type of contribution. If there are more than four contributors, click on the button.

The total number of pages of the item.
Example: 123

Numerals only. The sequence of pages of the item. Do not enter pp.
Example: 21 to 34

The name of the series to which the document belongs. Enter without punctuation.
Example: Elsevier Oceanography Series

The title of a journal, publication or magazine.
Example: Marine Biology

A person, firm or corporate body responsible for placing an item on the market. Do not use abbreviations, enter in full.
Example: Oxford University Press

Locality of the publisher. Use city or town then country. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Southampton, UK
Example: Brazil

City or town then country where event was held. If city is not known then just use country.
Example: Rome, Italy
Example: Greece

Start and end dates for the event
Example: 13-15 Dec 2003
Example: 31 Oct - 02 Nov 1999

The title of the conference or workshop.
Example: 11th Conference of Pan-Hellenic Librarians
Example: SIGIR 2001

Unique code identifying a book.
Example: 1 871438 57 8
Example: 067157826X

Unique code identifying a serial.
Example: 1055-0143
Example: 0891-060X
The type of the item presented at a conference or workshop.
Title usually found on the title page (first page of book).

The canonical URL for this item. Some journals require you to provide a link to their version.
Example: http://www.stuffjournal.com/2003/3/
URLs that are related to this item.
The date this EPrint was completed, submitted to a publisher, published or submitted for a Ph.D.
The event to which the date applies.
Please enter at least one date - for and deposits, you will need to enter at least the Accepted date.
You must enter an Accepted Date in
You must fully complete the Accepted Date in with a year, month and day.
Enter the volume number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
Enter the issue number of the journal or series in which your item appeared.
The unique (case-sensitive) identification number of this item, or a DOI.
The patent application number of this item.
The number, if any, of a technical report or similar item.
has ID that is not a valid .
Please enter at least one ID. Setting its type and an optional note (e.g. if the ISSN is print or online).
Please select the specific type of this monograph.
Please state here whether your deposit has been published, is currently in the process of being published (in press), or has not been previously published.
Please indicate whether this version of the work been refereed below.
Yes, this version has been refereed.
No, this version has not been refereed.
You are strongly encouraged to paste in the reference list of your item into the box below. It may be used to link your item to those it cites and to those that cite it.

If you think you can specify some useful information about your deposit that can't be entered anywhere else, please enter it here. This information will appear on the public summary page for this item.
Any comments to the editor. This information will not be displayed to the public.

Please enter the department from which the item originated.
Example: School of Electronics and Computer Science

Please enter the institution from which the item originated.
Example: University of Southampton

The name of the applicant to whom the patent was granted. May be a person or an organisation.
Example: Purdue Research Institute
Example: John K. Ducklingson
The contact email address for this item. If the full-text is not available to the public, then requests to view the full-text will be sent to this email. The email address will not be made public.
The sponsoring bodies who contributed funding for the creation of this item.
The names or codes of the projects that created this item.
The divisions with which this item should be associated.

The media of output.
Example: CD-ROM
Example: DVD

The type of the composition
Example: Concerto
Example: Opera
A person, firm or corporate body which holds the copyright for the item.
The pedagogic type that defines the resource.
The approximate learning time required to complete.
Outline of the main purpose of the tasks involved.

The skill areas covered.
Example: Language Learning

The learning level. This should link to a national/international framework to allow easy comparison of resources.
Example: Breakthrough 1-3
Example: GCSE
The number of the article within a journal or other publication. If this is an electronic/online publication this may be prefixed with an 'e'.
The edition of the book or book section.
A book or a conference volume.
A chapter or section in a book.
An article in a journal, magazine, newspaper. Not necessarily peer-reviewed. May be an electronic-only medium, such as an online journal or news website.

A paper, poster, speech, lecture or presentation given at a conference, workshop or other event. If the conference item has been published in a journal or book then please use "Book Section" or "Article" instead.
A monograph. This may be a technical report, project report, documentation, manual, working paper or discussion paper.
A published patent. Do not include as yet unpublished patent applications.
An artist's artefact or work product.
An artist's exhibition or site specific performance-based deposit.
A digital photograph or visual image.
A bounded collection of quantitative data (e.g. spreadsheet or XML data file).
Experimental data with intermediate analyses and summary results.
Lecture notes, exercises, exam papers or course syllabuses.
Author in quotations or text extracts

Enter an ISI query string:
AU = (Carr) and TI = (open access)
PY = 2006 and OG = (Cambridge)
Enter a DOI or DOIs, one per line e.g. doi:10.1006/jmbi.1998.2354

Unrecognised or invalid doi: .
Remote service status:

Duplicate DOI: .
This DOI already exists in the repository:

tr.td: OR select a file to import from:
Either cut-and-paste BibTeX entries into this box:
OR select a file to import from:
Or select a file to import from:

epp:phrases.epp:phrase: Failed to process file - perhaps it isn't an OpenXML document?
Browse by Year where Division is ""
Items where Division is "" and Year is
